member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.PrefixConversion
member.summary: Default shard name used if no specific sharding strategy is provided. Represents a potential transformation to apply to an entity ID prefix, used in saga routing. Allows sagas to be co-located or routed differently based on the originator's ID structure.

member.summary: Gets the time provider.

member.summary: Gets the hosting ActorSystem.

member.summary: Gets the configuration.

member.summary: Subscribes to the result of a command sent to another actor.

member.name: M:FCQRS.Common.IActor.Stop
member.summary: Stops the actor system gracefully.

member.name: M:FCQRS.Common.IActor.InitializeSagaStarter(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Object,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Akkling.Cluster.Sharding.IEntityRef{System.Object}},FCQRS.Common.PrefixConversion,System.Object}}})
member.summary: Initializes the Saga Starter actor, configuring which events trigger which sagas. <param name="eventHandler">A function mapping a received event object to a list of saga definitions to start: `obj -> list<(Factory * Prefix * StartingEvent)>`.</param>

Initializes a sharded, persistent saga actor. <param name="initialState">The initial state (`SagaState`) for new saga instances.</param> <param name="handleEvent">The event handler function: `Event -> SagaState -> EventAction`.</param> <param name="applySideEffects">Function determining side effects based on state transitions: `SagaState -> Option<StartingEvent> -> bool -> SagaTransition<NewState> * ExecuteCommand list`.</param> <param name="applyStateChange">Function to apply internal state changes: `SagaState -> SagaState`.</param> <param name="name">The shard type name for this saga.</param> <returns>An entity factory (`EntityFac<obj>`) for creating instances of this saga.</returns>

member.name: M:FCQRS.Common.IActor.InitializeActor``3(``0,System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{FCQRS.Common.Command{``1},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,FCQRS.Common.EventAction{``2}}},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{FCQRS.Common.Event{``2},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``0}})
member.summary: Initializes a sharded, persistent aggregate actor. <param name="cfg">Environment configuration (IConfiguration & ILoggerFactory).</param> <param name="initialState">The initial state for new aggregate instances.</param> <param name="name">The shard type name for this aggregate.</param> <param name="handleCommand">The command handler function: `Command -> State -> EventAction`.</param> <param name="apply">The event handler function: `Event -> State -> State`.</param> <returns>An entity factory (`EntityFac<obj>`) for creating instances of this actor.</returns>

Creates a command subscription to wait for a specific event from a target actor. Sends the command and asynchronously returns the first matching event received. <param name="factory">Entity factory function for the target actor type.</param> <param name="cid">Correlation ID for tracking.</param> <param name="id">Entity ID of the target actor.</param> <param name="command">The command payload to send.</param> <param name="filter">A predicate function to select the desired event.</param> <param name="metadata">Optional metadata to include with the command.</param> <returns>An async computation yielding the target event.</returns>

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.IActor
member.summary: Defines the core functionalities and context provided by the FCQRS environment to actors. This interface provides access to essential Akka.NET services and FCQRS initialization methods.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.SagaState`2.State
member.summary: The current state machine state of the saga.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.SagaState`2.Data
member.summary: The custom data associated with this saga instance.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaState`2
member.summary: Represents the state of a saga instance. <typeparam name="'SagaData">The type of the custom data held by the saga.</typeparam> <typeparam name="'State">The type representing the saga's current state machine state (e.g., an enum or DU).</typeparam>

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaTransition`1.NextState
member.summary: The saga should transition to a new state

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaTransition`1.Stay
member.summary: The saga should stay in current state without changes

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaTransition`1.StopSaga
member.summary: The saga should stop and terminate

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaTransition`1
member.summary: Represents the next state transition for a saga after processing an event or timeout.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.ExecuteCommand.DelayInMs
member.summary: An optional delay in milliseconds before sending the command.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.ExecuteCommand.Command
member.summary: The command message to send (boxed).

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.ExecuteCommand.TargetActor
member.summary: The target actor for the command.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.ExecuteCommand
member.summary: Represents a command to be executed, often scheduled or triggered by a saga.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetActor.Self
member.summary: Specifies the target as the current saga actor itself.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetActor.Sender
member.summary: Specifies the target as the original sender of the message that triggered the current saga step.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetActor.ActorRef
member.summary: Specifies the target using its direct IActorRef (usually boxed as obj).

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetActor.FactoryAndName
member.summary: Specifies the target using a factory function and name.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetActor
member.summary: Represents the target of a command execution triggered by a saga.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.FactoryAndName.Name
member.summary: The name identifier for the target actor.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.FactoryAndName.Factory
member.summary: The factory function (or entity ref creator) used to potentially create the actor.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.FactoryAndName
member.summary: Represents the information needed to locate or create a target actor, typically used within sagas.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetName.Originator
member.summary: Identify the target as the originator actor of the current saga process.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetName.Name
member.summary: Identify the target by its string name (entity ID).

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.TargetName
member.summary: Represents the name identifying a target actor for a command, typically used within sagas.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.StateChangedEvent
member.summary: Indicate that the state of a saga has changed (used internally by sagas for persistence).

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.UnhandledEvent
member.summary: Indicate that the command or event could not be handled in the current state.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.IgnoreEvent
member.summary: Ignore the event or command completely. No persistence, publishing, or state update occurs.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.PublishEvent
member.summary: Publish the event immediately to the mediator without persisting it. The actor's state is not updated.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.DeferEvent
member.summary: Defer the event. It will be stashed and processed later, potentially after other events.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1.PersistEvent
member.summary: Persist the event to the journal. The actor's state will be updated using the event handler *after* persistence succeeds.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.EventAction`1
member.summary: Defines the possible actions an aggregate or saga actor can take after processing a command or event. <typeparam name="'T">The type of the event payload associated with the action (e.g., for PersistEvent).</typeparam>

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata associated with the event.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.Version
member.summary: The version number of the aggregate after this event was applied.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.CorrelationId
member.summary: The correlation ID linking the event back to the originating command.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.Sender
member.summary: An optional identifier for the actor that generated the event.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.Id
member.summary: A unique identifier for the message.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.CreationDate
member.summary: The timestamp when the event was created.

member.name: P:FCQRS.Common.Event`1.EventDetails
member.summary: The specific details or payload of the event.

member.name: T:FCQRS.Common.SagaBuilder.SagaStateWrapper`2
member.summary: Standard wrapper for saga states that includes NotStarted/Started
High-level saga initialization that handles all wrapping automatically
Wraps user's handleEvent to skip NotStarted but allow Started states
Wraps user's applySideEffects to handle NotStarted/Started automatically

member.name: M:FCQRS.Query.ISubscribe`1.Subscribe(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{`0,System.Boolean},System.Int32,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{`0,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Subscribes to events using a filter. Only events for which the predicate returns true are processed, and the callback is invoked for each matching event up to a specified count.
member.param: Predicate function to determine if an event should be processed, e.g. fun event -> event.CorrelationId = targetId.
Maximum number of events to process.
Optional callback function to handle the event (defaults to ignoring the event if not provided).
An optional cancellation token to cancel the subscription.

member.name: M:FCQRS.Query.ISubscribe`1.Subscribe(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{`0,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Subscribes to all events and invokes the specified callback for each event.
member.param: Function invoked for each event, e.g. printing or processing the event.
An optional cancellation token to cancel the subscription.
